page.title: 09Our Lady and St.Anne Church.
page.content: Our Lady and St. Anne Church is in the parish of Poundstock.There was an Oratory used by the {Kingdom}family who were the squires of {Whitstone}, {Bridgerule}and{Poundstock}.Every summer the three brothers went on holiday.They were Claude who was Rector of Whitstone,another who was Rector of Bridgerule, and another who was Rector of a London church.While the brothers where on holiday at Wide mouth Bay they divided all the Sundays in a year between them and wrote out 1/3 of the sermons each and swapped them around for each week. Their church was first built in Maderia Drive,but two ladies had it moved to the Crescent.The church holds 22 people,there is a small Vestry and Altar.Timber built,8windows,20ft long,handmade kneelers each flower with Christian signifigance.
